title: How to know when to use an s, 's, or s' at the end of a word - Quora

response.answer_text: At end, simple s makes it plural. ( ‘) before (s) makes it possessive ( meaning ‘of’) for singular. Apostrophe (‘) after s is used for plural which already has an s at the end. It means ‘of’ (many) of the succeeding noun.
